marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: With the trend of declining interest rates, we assess that pressure on banking margins from the funding side - generally, not just for BBRI - will decrease. However, an acceleration in economic growth is needed before investors can see acceleration in quality credit growth - both in terms of margin and asset quality - and a reduction in the level of provision booking. From a valuation aspect, BBRI as of Tuesday (30/9) is trading at ~1.8x 1-Year Forward P/BV, about -1.5 Standard Deviation below the 5-year historical average.

marketNews.title: Hal lain yang lagi hot yang perlu kamu ketahui...
marketNews.content:
Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, told the Financial Times that the government is planning a stimulus package worth 2 billion US dollars to boost consumer spending during the Christmas and New Year holiday period. In this stimulus package, Airlangga mentioned that the government will provide discounts for transportation, groceries, retail purchases, and tax exemptions for airline tickets. Prior to this stimulus, the Financial Times reported that the government had announced a total stimulus package worth 4.5 billion US dollars since December 2024.
Chairman of the Indonesian Palm Oil Association (Gapki), Eddy Martono, stated that they estimate Indonesian palm oil exports will increase from the level of 29.5 million tons in 2024 to 30 million tons in 2025, driven by increased purchases from India. This estimate is higher than Gapki's previous projection in July 2025, which at that time projected Indonesian palm oil exports for 2025 would only reach 28 million tons due to the B40 biodiesel blending mandate. For 2026, Eddy mentioned that Indonesian palm oil exports will tend to stagnate year-on-year. Meanwhile, Indonesia's total palm oil production in 2026 is estimated to reach 56 million tons, up from the estimated production for 2025 at 55 million tons.
The Constitutional Court on Monday (29/9) annulled the requirement in the law regarding people's housing savings (Tapera) that obligates workers and employers to deposit a portion of their salary into the Tapera program. The Constitutional Court granted the request to make Tapera contributions optional, not mandatory. The Constitutional Court gave the DPR 2 years to revise the law.
Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, temporarily postponed the imposition of taxes for e-commerce traders with annual turnover between 500 million and 4.8 billion rupiah until the economic conditions stabilize. The Director of Economics at the Center of Economic and Law Studies, Nailul Huda, told Kontan that the additional tax revenue from this policy only ranges from 500 billion to 1.5 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) reports Bank Only Net Profit of IDR 4 Trillion in August 2025 (-16% YoY, +6% MoM)
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI) recorded bank only net profit of four trillion rupiah in August 2025 (-16% YoY, +6% MoM). This result brought the bank only net profit for 8M25 to reach 32.6 trillion rupiah (-10% YoY), equivalent to 57% of the 2025F consolidated estimate consensus (vs. 8M24: 60% consolidated realization for 2024).

tickerNews.title: High Provision Expenses Continue to Depress BBRI's Profit
tickerNews.content: The decrease in net profit in August 2025 was caused by weak Non-Interest Income (-25% YoY) - which pressed the Pre-Provision Operating Profit - and an increase in provision expenses (+34% YoY). Meanwhile, the decrease in net profit during 8M25 was driven by an increase in opex (+7% YoY) and provision expenses (+7% YoY). In August 2025, BBRI booked provision expenses of 3.5 trillion rupiah, marking the highest monthly provision expense since the beginning of the year, excluding January 2025 when BBRI recorded management overlay.

tickerNews.title: Slight Increase in BBRI's Loan Growth
tickerNews.content: As of August 2025, credit growth was at +6% YoY, slightly increasing compared to the June 2025 position of +5% YoY, although still below the consolidated 2025 guidance in the range of +7-9% YoY. In the 2Q25 earnings call, BBRI management indicated that credit growth until the end of 2025 could only reach the lower bound of the 2025 guidance, although this forecast was delivered before BBRI received a liquidity injection from the government amounting to 55 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Erajaya Group SSSG for 8M25: ERAA -1.5% YoY, ERAL +14.8% YoY
tickerNews.content: $ERAA: Erajaya Swasembada recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of +3% YoY in August 2025, resulting in SSSG for 8M25 contracting by -1.5% YoY (vs. 1H25: -3.1% YoY). Meanwhile, Sinar Eka Selaras ($ERAL) recorded SSSG of +9.2% YoY in August 2025, bringing SSSG for 8M25 to grow by +14.8% YoY (vs. 1H25: +15.8% YoY). On a consolidated basis, the Erajaya group added 33 stores in August 2025 - where ERAA opened 21 stores and ERAL opened 6 stores - bringing the total number of Erajaya group stores to 2,189 units as of August 2025.

tickerNews.title: Minister of Finance Reports BBNI Targeting Credit Growth Above +11% YoY in 2026
tickerNews.content: $BBNI: Katadata reported that Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, claimed Bank Negara Indonesia management targets credit growth above +11% YoY in 2026 - higher than the guidance for 2025 from BBNI management in the range of +8-10% YoY - in line with increased liquidity in the banking sector. Purbaya explained that the government will pursue faster credit growth starting in the next 2 months, and affirmed it will withdraw the placement of funds in BBNI worth 55 trillion rupiah if credit growth is deemed weak.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Increases Stake in SCMA to 67.2% via Stock Purchase
tickerNews.content: $SCMA: The controller of Surya Citra Media, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), bought ~234 million SCMA shares at an average price of ~353 rupiah per share on September 23–29, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~82.5 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 66.89% to 67.2%.

tickerNews.title: Astrindo Nusantara (BIPI) to Execute Waste-to-Energy Project Worth US$300–350 Million Next Year
tickerNews.content: $BIPI: President Director of Astrindo Nusantara Infrastruktur, Raymond Anthony Gerungan, said that the company will work on a waste-to-energy project worth 300–350 million US dollars in 2026, with a feasibility study for this project expected to be completed in the next few weeks. Previously, Raymond stated at the end of 2024 that the company was then participating in the auction for a waste-to-power plant (PLTSa) project in Java.

tickerNews.title: Medikaloka Hermina (HEAL) Commissioner Meijani Wibowo Increases Share Ownership
tickerNews.content: $HEAL: Commissioner of Medikaloka Hermina, Meijani Wibowo, purchased ~3.4 million HEAL shares at an average price of 1,840 rupiah per share on September 25, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~6.3 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Meijani Wibowo's direct ownership in HEAL increased from ~1.95% to ~1.97%.

tickerNews.title: KETR Plans to Add Domestic and Overseas Shipping Business Segments
tickerNews.content: $KETR: Ketrosden Triasmitra plans to add business activities in the segment of domestic sea transportation for general cargo and overseas sea transportation for general cargo. KETR explained that this step is in line with the company's strategy to utilize its asset, namely the undersea fiber optic cable laying vessel (CLV) Bentang Bahari. The vessel is planned to be commercialized to third parties, thus requiring a shipping company business license that necessitates this addition of business activities. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on October 1, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Tower Bersama Infrastructure (TBIG) Plans Transfer of Treasury Shares to Controller
tickerNews.content: Tower Bersama Infrastructure ($TBIG) plans to transfer treasury shares totaling ~350.3 million (~1.5%) shares to the company's controller, Bersama Digital Infrastructure Asia Pte. Ltd., during the period of October 6 - December 31, 2025. The maximum treasury shares to be transferred in this transaction plan is equivalent to all of the company's current treasury shares.
